Class ReminderController

java.lang.Object
Classes.ReminderController
public class ReminderController extends Object
Manages reminders for a user, including creating, editing, and deleting reminders in a database. This class interacts with the database to store and manipulate reminder data associated with a user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ReminderController(User user, Connection c)
    Constructor for the ReminderController class that initializes the user, database connection, and sets up a Scanner for user input.

  • Constructor Details

    • ReminderController

      public ReminderController(User user, Connection c)
      Constructor for the ReminderController class that initializes the user, database connection, and sets up a Scanner for user input. It also creates the reminders table if it doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      user - the user object associated with the reminders
      c - the database connection used to interact with the reminders table

  • Method Details

    • menu

      public ReminderController menu()
      Displays the main menu for managing reminders and handles user input to perform operations.

      This method provides the following options: 1. Create Reminder: Allows the user to create a new reminder and store it in the database. 2. Edit Reminder: Enables the user to modify an existing reminder by its unique ID. 3. Delete Reminder: Removes an existing reminder identified by its unique ID.

      For operations requiring a reminder ID (Edit/Delete), this method validates the user-provided ID to ensure an existing reminder is being modified or removed.

      Returns:
      null (this method does not return a meaningful value)

    • createReminder

      public void createReminder()
      Creates a new reminder by collecting details from the user and storing them in the database.

      This method: - Prompts the user to enter a unique reminder ID and validates that it doesn't already exist. - Collects the reminder title, date, and time from the user. - Inserts the new reminder into the database with the associated user's email.

    • editReminder

      public void editReminder(String id)
      Edits an existing reminder by allowing the user to modify its title, date, or time.

      This method provides the following options: 1. Title: Modifies the reminder's title. 2. Date: Updates the reminder's date. 3. Time: Changes the reminder's time. 4. Change All: Updates all fields (title, date, and time).

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the reminder to be edited

    • editTitle

      public void editTitle(String id)
      Updates the title of an existing reminder in the database.

      This method: - Retrieves and displays the current title of the reminder. - Prompts the user to enter a new title and validates that it is not empty. - Updates the reminder's title in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the reminder to update

    • editDate

      public void editDate(String id)
      Updates the date of an existing reminder in the database.

      This method: - Retrieves and displays the current date of the reminder. - Prompts the user to enter a new date and validates that it is not empty. - Updates the reminder's date in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the reminder to update

    • editTime

      public void editTime(String id)
      Updates the time of an existing reminder in the database.

      This method: - Retrieves and displays the current time of the reminder. - Prompts the user to enter a new time and validates that it is not empty. - Updates the reminder's time in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the reminder to update

    • deleteReminder

      public void deleteReminder(String id)
      Deletes a reminder from the database based on its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the reminder to be deleted

    • validateId

      public boolean validateId(String id)
      Validates whether a reminder ID exists and belongs to the current user.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the reminder to validate
      Returns:
      true if the ID exists and belongs to the user, false otherwise
